TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ConfigurationProperty extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents an attribute or a child of a configuration element. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the case of a simple <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement>, such as the `CustomSection` shown in the next example, the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty> objects represent attributes such as `fileName`.
In the case of more complex configuration elements such as a section containing subsections, for instance `authentication`, the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty> objects can represent <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement> objects as well as attributes.
The <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection> class represents the collection of the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty> objects that can be either attributes or <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement> objects of a configuration element.
The <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty> class represents an individual configuration setting. This class allows you to get or set the name, type, and default value for a particular configuration entity (attribute or element) and specify whether the attribute is required, is an element key, or represents a default element collection.
## Examples
1. The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty> when you create a custom section.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty/CS/ConfigurationProperty.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty/VB/ConfigurationProperty.vb#1)]
The following is an excerpt of the configuration file used by the code in the previous example.
The following example shows how to create the previous section in code.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty#30](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty/CS/ConfigurationProperty.cs#30)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty#30](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty/VB/ConfigurationProperty.vb#30)]

block.para:
Every object creates an internal collection of objects that represents either the element attributes or a collection of child elements.
Non-customizable information and functionality is contained by an object provided by the property.
You can use a programmatic or a declarative (attributed) coding model to create a custom configuration element.
- Programmatic Model. This model requires that you create a property for each element attribute to get and/or set its value and add it to the internal property bag of the underlying base class.
- Declarative Model. This simpler model, also called attributed model, allows you to define an element attribute by using a property and decorate it with attributes. These attributes instruct the ASP.NET configuration system about the property types and their default values. With this information, obtained through reflection, the ASP.NET configuration system creates the element property objects for you and performs the required initialization.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you instantiate a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty> object using this constructor, the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty.IsRequired%2A> and <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty.IsKey%2A> properties are set to `false`. Additionally, an instance made with this constructor will not function as a default collection-key property.

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the assembly name for the configuration property requires transformation when it is serialized for an earlier version of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
Docs.value: if the property requires assembly name transformation; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You use <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyOptions> to set this property when you call a constructor that includes a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyOptions> parameter. This value is ignored if the property does not contain an assembly name string.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the property is the default collection of an element.
Docs.value: if the property is the default collection of an element; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value is ignored if the property is not a collection.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is the key for the containing object.
Docs.value: if this object is the key for the containing element; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can define a new <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty> object to be the key for the containing element when implementing the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement> element. If this flag is not used, the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty.IsKey%2A> property will return `false`.
## Examples The following code example shows how to get the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty.IsKey%2A> property for a specified property.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty/CS/ConfigurationProperty.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty/VB/ConfigurationProperty.vb#7)]

Docs.value: if the is required; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the type name for the configuration property requires transformation when it is serialized for an earlier version of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
Docs.value: if the property requires type-name transformation; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You use <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyOptions> to set this property when you call a constructor that includes a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyOptions> parameter. This value is ignored if the property does not contain a type-name string.

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the configuration property's parent configuration section is queried at serialization time to determine whether the configuration property should be serialized into XML.
Docs.value: if the parent configuration section should be queried; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you are creating a configuration property for the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)] or later versions, and if the property value should not be serialized to XML when an earlier version of the framework is targeted, set this property to `true`.
You use <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyOptions> to set this property when you call a constructor that includes a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyOptions> parameter.

## Remarks If an instance of a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty> is a default collection, its name will be automatically defined to be an empty string.
